name: Crystals and Essences
description: Tell me, kit, do you believe in magic? Well, of course you do, thats a foolish question. Do you believe in the existance of auras, the power of crystals, and the infinite depth of magic itself? Now that...that is a proper question! My name is Wizard Watson. Please, step into my study, Bandit, I feel we can definitely help each other to answer this...

quests.name: Improved Wandcraft
quests.description: Now that you have an Infusion Altar, you can vastly increase the power of both your Wands and the Foci you use with them.                     You are starting to get into more and more powerful Thaumaturgy, so you'll want your Wand to match. Your basic wands can only take you so far.                  I highly suggest improving the Stability of your Infusion Altar. Wiggle helped me set up a grid of Candles and Skulls underneath it, for example.                                   You can find all these researches on the Thaumaturgy tab.

tasks.longDescription: To improve the Wand Caps for our Wands, we're going to have to do a bit more than just shape them in an Arcane Worktable. You'll need to infuse some Aspects and materials with your Infusion Altar as well to get the most out of them.      Silver Wand Caps are very good at channeling the four Primal Aspects (Aer, Ignis, Aqua, Terra).       Thaumium Wand Caps are good at working with all types of Vis.

There are six researches off the Greatwood Wand Core you can outright pay Research Points for. Each of these specialized Wand Cores corresponds to one of the six core Aspects. These Cores hold more Vis than a Greatwood Wand.          They also each have a special property : If their Vis type ever drops below 10%, they will slowly generate more. For example, a Blazing Rod will renegerate Ignis, while an Icy Rod will regenerate Aqua.

Greatwood and specialized Wands are much better than that Iron and Wood thing you started with, yeah? Well, how about we go the next step up?                          Silverwood Trees have great magical properties, so turning their wood into a Wand is only logical. It will give you double the Vis capacity of a normal Greatwood Wand, which will open up the doors to bigger pieces of Thaumaturgy!

quests.name: Advanced Distillation
quests.description: Essentia Pipe networks are fickle, complicated beasts. I still don't quite understand them myself, but thats why I have my familiar Wiggle to help me. She's the one who helped get this research into the Thauminomicon in the first place!          There are plenty of advanced devices you can use in a Essentia network, and all of them, when used properly, are a great boon to any good Thaumaturge.

tasks.longDescription: Wiggle says using these special tubes can help make your network a bit more compact, and less prone to gumming up.                                The Filtered Essentia Tube can have a Jar Label marked with a specific Essentia attatched to it. It will act just like a labeled Warded Jar : Only Essentia of that type will pass through it.                               The Restriction tube will halve the 'suction' power of any jar or device thats drawing Essentia through it. This is good for setting a 'preferred' path if there are multiple devices creation suction.         The Directional Essentia Tube will only allow Essentia to travel in one direction.

In the Essentia Distillation research, you unlocked the ability to make an item that we haven't had a use for until now : The Alchemical Construct. By itself, it isn't very useful, but instead is a component in a few more advanced devices.

With Glass Phials, we can capture Essentia as a sort of gassy liquid, but only in amounts of 8. This is good if we're making something that requires a lot of one Essentia, or mass producing something. But if we want more precision...                                      The Essentia Crystalizer, when Essentia is piped into it, will slowly convert Essentia into small Crystals. Each Crystal is a single Essentia point, but it takes a while for each Crystal to form. You can place a Chest next to the Crystalizer and it will deposit the Crystal into it.

The Alchemical Centrifuge research gives you access to two advanced devices.                           The Alchemical Centrifuge will take 'liquid' Essentia fed into the bottom of it, and break it down into the Aspects that make it (So Centrifuging Lux would break down into Aer and Ignis for example). For each Essentia it breaks down, it will will only generate and keep one of the components, though it won't pipe it.                                           For that, you'll need the Essentia Buffer. This special pipe has very minor 'suction' power, but it can store up to 8 of any combination of Essentia. Pipes can connect to any side of it.

Unlocking the Automated Alchemy research will enable you to create the Alchemical Construct, a device that can take Essentia directly from a Pipe network and do Alchemy for you.                                        Place two Alchemical Constructs, one on top of another, on top of a Crucible. The Crucible needs to be heated as usual, but doesn't require water. Then take your Wand with 30 Ordo, 30 Aqua, and 15 Ignis, and Right Click on one of the Constructs. If successful, you'll transform it into the Alchemical Construct! Now just hook it up to your Essentia Pipe network.               Right Clicking it will open an interface. Place the Catalyst in the left slot to see what it makes in the right. The bar down below shows what Essentia is required, and in what order (going left to right). If the Catalyst makes the item you are looking for, click the right hand slot to activate the Construct.              Normally the Construct can only do a single Alchemy production at a time, but by making and attatching Mnemotic Matrixes to the sides of the Construct by Sneak + Right Clicking them onto the machine, you can increase the number it will make at once. Each Matrix increases the operations by 1.

The Void Jar acts like a normal Warded Jar, except when it's full, it doesn't stop trying to draw more Essentia. Any extra Essentia is, instead, destroyed.                          Before Wiggles helped with this Research, we used to have chests full of certain Aspects...it was kind of a mess.

Now, I'm pretty sure you've caught onto the slight...wariness...I've had when I start talking about Taint. That's because it's a very dangerous thing that can easily get out of control if you let it. I won't get too much into it yet, you aren't ready, but I will teach you a very special Alchemical recipe you'll need.              Around Silverwood Trees you may occasionally find these crystal like flowers. If you've tried to grab one, it usually falls apart...but if you use a pair of Shears on it, you can harvest it. This is the catalyst you'll need to make an Ethereal Bloom.                                           This special flower can be planted near Tainted lands to reverse it's poisonous advance, and hold it at bay. It only works for a short distance, so you'll need a lot of them.                          If you are having problems finding a lot of Shimmerleaf to make Etheral Blooms, I do provide a supply of them in the Corporate Shop.

quests.name: The Basics of Artificing
quests.description: There are a handful of simple things you can make with some mundane materials and just a touch of magic.                                        Most of these items will be useful in one way or another to you, whether its a component of a much more Thaumaturgic nature, or simply a nice looking piece.                  As a bonus, many of these look very magical in nature! Very wizardly to have around, if just for the look of things!

tasks.longDescription: Arcane Stone Blocks are a basis for many magical constructs. The Stone is reinforced with a bit of magical fire and the strength of the earth.

The Item Grate is a good way to keep items from, say, falling into your Crucible. Or allow only items to fall through the floor in an area.                                           When placed, you can Right Click the grate to open or close it. If open, items dropped on the ground will slowly fall through it.

The Artifice tab has two researches connected to the Arcane Stone Block : The Paving Stone of Travel and Warding.             The Paving Stone of Travel increases the speed of anything that walks over it for a few seconds.                                       The Paving Stone of Warding creates a barrier that can prevent most creatures from crossing over it, other than you and any Assistants you may have. It isn't perfect, though, some creatures are smarter than they appear.

You can weave some enchanted fabric on the Arcane Worktable with a bit of Wool and String, infusing it with a bit of magic.                           This cloth can then be used to make a simple set of wizardly clothing, which will lower the cost of casting spells from your Wand.           You can also dye this clothing just as you would Leather Armor, by placing it and the dye in a crafting table.
There is a basic set of Baubles and accessories you can make, that will become quite useful later on.

The Artificing tab is not the only one with some basic Artifice devices. In the Golemancy tab, you can learn how to make the Hungry Chest.                                          The Hungry Chest is your first foray into animating creations in various ways. It will grab and store any items that drop near enough to touch it.

Have you scanned a Bone and a Bow with your Thaumometer? If not, do so! You'll find a research that some crafty if...slightly morbid... thaumaturge of old came up with.         The Bone Bow fires faster and hits harder than a regular bow. The arrows fired from it also travel farther.

quests.name: Alchemical Distillation
quests.description: Now that you know the basics of Alchemy, the next step is to refine how you use Essentia to minimize waste.                                          That was kind of a mouthful, wasn't it? To put it in simpler terms, right now you are just tossing normal items into the Crucible to get the Aspects you want, and this usually leaves a lot left over in your Crucible, which breaks down into Taint. Which isn't a good thing, honestly!                                       Using Arcane Alembics and Essentia Tubes, you can distill basic items in an Alchemical Furnace into pure Essentia. This way, you can utilize everything that makes up an item, instead of risking waking things from the Dungeon Dimension.                                     Oh yes, keep in mind that all these Researches are in the Alchemy tab of your Thauminomicon.

tasks.longDescription: First things first, you'll need the Alchemical Furnace. You can convert a Cauldron into a Crucible the same way as always, placing the Cauldron and tapping it with your Wand. Then just break with a Pick or something to pick it up.

I'm not sure if you've come across one yet, but like Greatwood Trees, you can find these special Silverwood Trees occasionally when exploring. Their trunk is a silvery-white color, and the leaves are a deep blue, and usually stand out fairly well! Silverwood harnesses magic very well, so be sure to collect as many logs as you can, as well as any Saplings to grow your own later!                       With a Silverwood Plank and some Gold, you can make a Vis Filter, which is a component for a few Distillation tools you'll need.

The Alchemical Furnace uses solid fuel to break down items into their basic elements in the form of a slurry. If you use Alumentum, it breaks down things faster.                The broken down slurry, though, needs to be distilled further by the use of Alchemical Alembics. By placing one on top of the Arcane Furnace (by Sneak + Right Clicking it on top), it will extract a single type of Essentia. You can stack more Alembics on top of that one, up to FIVE of them! This way, you can utilize ALL the Essentia from an item!                                         You can Right Click a wand on an Alembic to face the flat part of it towards you. Shift + Right Clicking will empty any Essentia contained in it.

Now that the Alembics have distilled Essentia, you need a way to contain it for use later.                The simplest way is to take a Glass Phial, which you make like a Glass Bottle but cap it with Clay, and Right Click it onto an Alembic if it has 8 or more Essentia when you look at it. A Glass Phial can only hold 8 Essentia at a time.                   Another way to store Essentia is to Pipe it. Essentia Tubes are a bit fiddly, but they are the best way to transport and fill various other containers and devices. A tube can only carry one Essence type at a time, and a badly constructed network can get gummed up.                                    You can combine a Tube and a Lever to make a Valve, which lets you control the Essentia traveling through it.                                     The Essentia Resonator can be Right Clicked onto a Tube or Essentia containing device to see what it contains and where the 'suction' is coming from thats drawing Essentia.

The most useful thing you can store Essentia in is a Warded Jar. It can be easily picked up and moved around, and it can hold a good amount. You can also Right Click a Glass Phial on one to bottle the Essentia (if it has at least 8, don't forget!).                               Oh yes, Wiggle wanted me to mention that you can also make Jar Labels. Right Click it on a Jar that contains Essentia to automatically mark it with that type. You can also combine a blank Jar Label with any Phial of Essentia to 'mark' it with that Essentia. Then you slap it on a Jar, and only that Essentia will ever go into it, even if its been emptied.                                        You can remove a label by Sneak + Right Clicking a Jar with an empty hand.

quests.name: Your Thaumic Materials
quests.description: You got a Wand. You got a magic book. Now you need some reagents!      Every world I've encountered has these basic magical materials in the ground.                                    Crystals are a core component to most Thaumcraft creations, as they harness the magical energies of the universe within them. There are six basic crystals you can find in the ground just by mining regularly.                                      There are also two other components you will need to find : Cinnbar Ore and Amber.

tasks.longDescription: The first four crystal types you will need are the Element crystals : Fire, Earth, Air, and Water. Each contains some magic and the corresponding element.
The two other crystal shards you will need to find are Order and Entropy, two opposites of the same fundamental force of the universe.

The final two resources you will need encompass Life in different ways.                                            Amber is fossilized tree sap, and commonly contains within it insects and other living things, trapped in time.                                Cinnabar Ore can be found about as commonly as any of the Crystal Shards. By smelting it, you turn it into Quicksilver, also known as Mercury, the embodiment of the ever changing, shifting thing called Life.

quests.name: Intermediate Artificing
quests.description: Thaumaturges can make all manner of mundane and mystical objects. Some of them don't have an immediately obvious use, while others are infinitely valuable to the smart wizard.                            Here are some quite useful Artifices that should help you around the wizard tower... bunker... house? I'm not sure on what your living situation is on that world. Wiggle and I hope its comfortable, at least!

tasks.longDescription: The Primal Charm isn't very useful right now, but its good to know how to craft one for later. Though, I suggest keeping the Charm in your inventory for a while. Sometimes it can give you insight into new Research you can persue.

Stairs aren't very magical, and in a cramped wizard tower they can also be fairly dangerous.                 The Arcane Levitator research in the Artifice tab solves this problem in a very wizardly way! A single Levitator can lift you up about 10 blocks high. If you stack multiple, each one will increase the lift by another 10!                          To descend, Sneak instead and you'll be gently lowered.

A Thaumaturge's home is his castle. One with many important, and dangerous, creations! A good wizard has ways of keeping most everyone out. The Warded Arcana research gives you access to a good handful of items to help.            Warded Doors can only be opened or removed by the person who places them. To allow others access, though, you'll need to craft some Keys.                             Iron Keys can be Right Clicked onto a door you've placed to Bind it to that door. You can give this to an assistant, and he can use it on the same door to gain permanent access to it.                                  Gold Keys function the same way, but with one bonus : It grants the user the ability to make Iron Keys for that door as well. Only the actual owner of the door can bind Gold Keys to it, though.

The Arcane Pressure Plate can be configured to trigger in three ways : By everything (like a normal plate), by only you, or by everything BUT you.                         Arcane Keys can be used on them just like with Warded Doors. If you are using an Arcane Pressure Plate to open a Warded Door, the assistant needs to have access to both Door and Plate.                       Just like Warded Doors, only the person who placed them can remove them.
Just like Warded Doors and Arcane Pressure Plates, Warded Glass cannot be broken by anyone but the person who placed it.             Arcane Keys do not work on Warded Glass, though.

More than likely, you've scanned one of those strange Endermen or one of their Pearls with your Thaumometer. They seem to be of another world, don't they?                Just something to keep in mind. What? Oh, right! Another thing you can do with Glass is turn it into Mirrored Glass, by applying some Quicksilver to a Glass Pane. Not useful just yet, but it will be soon, trust me!

The Bone Bow was an improvement on a regular Bow, but its not the only thing you can improve.                                         By combining some normal Arrows with a Shard, you can make Elemental Arrows. Each Primal Element does something different.

quests.name: Dark Research
quests.description: Now then, you may have noticed in your Thauminomicon, some Researches have this sort of...black cloud around them. This signifies that this knowledge is Forbidden.                                     To put it plainly, some things we Thaumaturges have learned was not meant for mortal minds. Eldritch knowledge, gleaned from the Elder Gods, the Dungeon Dimensions, and even further out. By learning these, we gain great power, but we also warp our minds just a little bit.      That is why the effect "Warp". Researching forbidden knowledge can gain you two types : normal Warp, and Permanent Warp. Normal warp slowly dissipates. You can guess what the other doesn't do.        The more Warp you have, the more chances you have of a Warp Effect taking place. At small amounts of Warp, it usually is just blurred vision, hearing things, etc. At higher amounts, you may see things...and given that you are a Thaumaturge, your mind can make it real.                                             There are many ways to mitigate these effects, to control them. As Wiggles says (since I showed her that blasted movie...) "With great power comes great responsibility."                               I need to teach you both about the Warp and about Taint. Please research the following :               [Basic Knowledge]                            Research Mastery                       Research Duplication                [Alchemy]                                      Alchemical Duplication                   Alchemical Manufacture                 Entropic Processing               [Artifice]                                       Infernal Furnace                        Sinister Lodestone

tasks.longDescription: In your Alchemy tab, off of Entropic Processing, are two pieces of Forbidden Knowledge involving Taint. Research them both before creating them, which will hopefully give you enough time to feel a minor Warp Effect.                  Bottled Taint is, more or less, a concentrated bottle of Tait. When used, you throw it like a Splash Potion, and it'll convert a small area to Tainted Land, where Taint will start to grow and spread.            Liquid Death is a fluid that really doesn't leave much to the imagination. Anything living or even pretending to be alive cannot survive in it. The upside of this dangerous substance, is that any creature that dies in it, the Essence they would normally drop crystalizes and can be retrieved.

Have you had a Warp Effect yet? No? Well, either way, there's a bit more research we can do while waiting.                                         You researched the Infernal Furnace in the Artifice tab, which is a large structure you can construct to smelt items without fuel. Unfortunately, it can be a bit slow. Fortunately, a new Research is available connected to it!              The Arcane Bellows can be attached to the side of the Infernal Furnace to both speed it up, and give you a chance at bonus items depending on what you smelt.      You can also attach the Arcane Bellows to Alchemical Furnaces to speed them up, or to normal Crucibles to get the water boiling faster.

Have you had a Warp Effect yet? You may not have noticed it yet, but your Thauminomicon would have! Check your Alchemy tab. In the upper left should be Purifying Bath Salts. If you don't see it, go ahead and do other things till you can Research it. You may need to do more Quests and Research to build up your Permanent Warp, so feel free to see what other tasks Wiggles and I have for you. Got it? Good!                                            Puryfing Bath Salts can help ease and lower the effects of Warp. You will need to make Salis Mundus by smelting a Balance Shard in any furnace, and use it as a Catalyst for an Alchemical recipe.     By creating a small pool of water and tossing the Bath Salts in, they will eventually dissolve, turning the water into a Puryfing Bath.                                            A note : Aurum Essentia is a bit hard to come by. The best place to find it is in Ethereal Essences, which can drop from magical Wisps, or more commonly by breaking an Aura Node with a pickaxe.

Purifying Bath Salts are great for cleaning the body, but you need something for the Mind as well.     By combining nine Magic Tallow into a Tallow Block and using it as a Catalyst, you can make Sanitizing Soap, which has a chance of removing Temporary Warp when used. The chance is greater when you are also under the effects of Purifying Bath Salts.

Dumping Water and Bath Salts into a hole each time you want to Purify yourself is a hassle. Why not make a Spa?                             The Arcane Spa, when filled with Water, will pump it into a 5x5 area above it. Adding Bath Salts to the Spa will automatically add it to the water as well.                                You can also have the Arcane Spa pump almost any liquid above it instead of Water.

quests.name: Aura Cascade
quests.description: Hello? Hello are...oh, hi there! Um...not to disturb you and my Master's work but...I may have something new you may be interested in. Maybe?                       Um, who am I you ask? Well, you may notice the Master talk about his familiar a lot. That would be, well...me. My name is Wiggle, and the Master summoned me from another dimension to aid him. It was ah uh...very complicated magical contract, and I still have about twenty years of being his Familiar before the contract is up....                 I can tell you have some...um...questions. I'm not a slave, I can leave when I want, I just forfeit the rewards and power I'd get as part of the deal...

tasks.longDescription: To start off with well...you'll need to make some crystals. White Aura Crystals, actually, which will be the primary component in much of what we do.                                 Thank goodness they aren't too expensive...

What...oh! Right! I have my own powers and knowledge I'm willing to share with you. Like Thaumcraft, what I can teach you is fairly complex but...in a different way. Can...can you make this Encyclopedia? It'll fill with all the knowledge on its own, and it'll help both of us as I teach you.

quests.name: Thaumcraft
quests.description: Yes, yes, please, close the door behind you. All good? Phew! Take a seat, just push aside all that junk and...oh, right, you aren't really here. Well, if you have a seat handy over where you are, please, be seated for a moment.                         Sorry about the flowery language out there. There are apperances the mundane folk expect of us. My name is Wizard Watson, and I'm the head Thaumaturge here at The Ferret Business.                                      I hear your world is just ripe with untapped magical potential! Marvelous! Here, we have to keep a tighter control on magic, otherwise things'll get out of control by power hungry dolts.                          Your world is untapped, raw, and...empty. This will give us an amazing opportunity to teach you about the magic of Thaumcraft and further our own research as far as we can go, while we work on a way to get you home!

tasks.longDescription: Now then, to get started, you'll need a wand. You can make a pretty simple wand with some Iron and a Stick! Not very magical sounding now that you know, eh?                      Take some Iron Ingots and break them down into nuggets, and make a few Iron Wand Caps, then stick them on either end of a Stick. Whoosh, a Wand!

Now now, I know it seems a bit, well...mundane. A bit of metal on a stick does not a wand make, right? Well...hold on, where did I put it....          Merlin's beard I really need to clean this place some time. I had a spare book for you, but I can't seem to find it. Do you happen to have a Bookshelf near by? Just a regular one, nothing fancy! I can show you your first bit of magic!         Take that Iron Capped Wand, aim at that Bookshelf, and Right Click it!

Now that's what I call magic! What you have now is the Thauminomicon, your guide into the world of Thaumcraft. Inside its mystical pages is everything we Thaumaturges have learned, will learn, may learn, and more.                Look carefully through the book. There is so much for us to cover, but I know you'll do just fine. If you ever lose your Thauminomicon, just use any Wand on a normal Bookshelf to create another one, your new Thauminomicon will remember your progress.

quests.name: Advanced Wandcraft
quests.description: We can do much with just a couple Wand Caps and a Wand Core already, but sometimes even that isn't enough for a powerful Thaumaturge!                                 A grand wizard can make and use more than small Wands. There are various other magic channeling items, whether its a Staff, an Amulet, or even greater things! Not even the sky is the limit.

tasks.longDescription: One improvement we can make to Wands is an idea we Thaumaturges got from the electrical branches of the Ferret Business. Or did they get the idea from us? Either way, I'm talking about a portable energy storage!                                       No no, not a battery. Well, not exactly! It's actually an Amulet that you wear around your neck! You charge it in a Wand Recharge Station first. Then, while out in the field, just hold out your Wand and it'll slowly recharge from the Amulet.

Sometimes, you just don't need to be able to use a Foci with your Wand most of the time. If that's the case, you can sacrifice the Foci spot for some extra storage and power from the Wand itself!                By replacing the top with a Primal Charm and capping it with two Wand Caps instead of one, you can make a Scepter instead of a Wand. Not only does it give you a decent Vis usage discount, it also gives you 50% more Vis storage than the Wand Core usually has.                     Wiggles suggests that if you're going to make a powerful Scepter, make it Powerful with a capital P. Use Thaumium Wand Caps and a Silverwood Core, please.

Wands are great for compact magical workings, but sometimes you want something bigger!                      You can combine two Greatwood Wand Cores and a Primal Charm into a Greatwood Staff Core. Then add Wand Caps to the end like a normal Wand, and you got a big Wand...I mean Staff! Wiggles stop giggling....       Anyways! A Greatwood Staff has more than double the Vis storage of a Greatwood Wand. The downside is you cannot use it in an Arcane Workbench or similar.
Just like with Greatwood Wands, you can make specialized Staves as well, each one better at channeling a specific type of Vis.
Oh, and the bonus of using a Staff over a Wand? In a pinch, you can use it to club something over the head that's giving you trouble!

Another thing you can research is the Vis Charge Relay. By placing it on top of your Arcane Workbench, it can draw C-Vis from the network to recharge the Wand in the Workbench.                           Do note this is a lot slower than just picking up the Wand and tossing it into a Recharge Pedestal directly.

quests.name: The Power of Infusion
quests.description: Alchemical creations and Arcane Worktable constructions can only harness so much magical potential. For the big, fun stuff, we're going to have to get into Infusion Rituals.     The start of this research can be found on the Artifice tab of your Thauminomicon. Just a fair warning : This is a very involved process. It will require using your Alchemical Distillation techhniques, and can be very dangerous if not done correctly. I'll do my best to explain things, but you should always read your Thauminomicon closely!

tasks.longDescription: You'll want a large, open area for this. I mean big, at least 10x10 if not larger. Also, be sure its in a safe location, because failure can be... catastrophic. Just a fair warning!                                        You will need 4 Arcane Stone Blocks, 4 Arcane Stone Bricks, an Arcane Pedestal, and a Runic Matrix. Just to make things easier, make a total of 9 Arcane Pedestals, as you'll need them.                        Follow the layout in your Thauminomicon. Keep in mind, there is an empty space between the center Pedestal and the Runic Matrix above it. When ready, Right Click your Wand on the Matrix (if it has enough Vis of all the Aspects!) to construct the Infusion Altar. It should very obviously change.

Now, as I said, Infusion is powerful and dangerous. Before we do the first infusion, we should reduce what is called Instability. The more powerful an item you are infusing, the more Instability it has when doing the Infusion Ritual.           You can reduce Instability by placing certain magical objects around the Infusion Altar. Candles, Skulls, and Crystals are the most common.                                         Any item you place needs to be counterbalanced on the opposite side. If you place a Candle three blocks North of the center, place another one three blocks South. For even more stabilty, place two more to the East and West as well!       To start, I suggest gathering four White Tallow Candles, two Zombie Heads, and two Skeleton Skulls. Along with the other eight Arcane Pedestals I had you make, you should be able to add a bit of stability to your future Infusions.       Be sure to consult the Thauminomicon page on the Infusion Altar!

As you can see, you now have a whole lot of new Researches branching off the Infusion one. For introduction, we'll make something I feel will be quite useful and stylish where you are : Boots of the Traveler. Go ahead and research it, and start gathering the components.                                   The shards, fish, Enchanted Cloth, Leather Boots, and Feather are simple to gather. The more difficult part is gathering the Iter and Volatus Essentia. I highly suggest you take a peak at a simple Boat and some chicken Feathers.         When you have the Essentia needed in Warded Jars, go over to your Infusion Altar. Place the Leather Boots in the center Pedestal, then the other components on the Pedestals on the outside. You need to keep a balance of items : an item placed on a North pedestal needs to have an item placed on a South pedestal. If there are an odd number of items, then one item will have an empty pedestal opposite it.                         Make sure each item is placed correctly, then place the Warded Jars within 10 blocks of the Altar. When everything is in place, Right Click your Wand on the Runic Matrix.    Watch the Infusion carefully. If an item pops off its Pedestal instead of getting absorbed, quickly put it back on!

quests.name: The Basics of Wand Usage
quests.description: Your studies are progressing nicely I have to say! Now what is next...hmm...Wiggle! Wiggle where are you?                                              Oh bother, I sent Wiggle out a while ago to find a book for me. Hm? Oh, sorry! Wiggle is my familiar. She's a real help around here. Now...hm...Oh, I know! I should teach you the basics of Artificing and Vis Collecting.                                      You may have noticed when wandering around with your Thaumometer, some very bright points hovering around the world. Did you scan one yet? You should! These are called Aura Nodes, and they contain energy called Vis. Vis usually comes in the 6 base elements, but sometimes you'll find a node with a compound element!            Be sure to scan every node you find, your Thamic Knowledge will remember their locations for use when you've advanced a little bit.        Oh, right, do you have Copper Wand Caps researched yet? Please do, its in the Thaumaturgy tab of your Thauminomicon!

tasks.longDescription: The first thing you'll need to do is go find some Aura Nodes. Hold your Wand and hold Right Click on them to start absorbing the Vis from it. Your starting wand can't hold much, but try to fill all the aspects you can. You can also collect them from killing monsters.       Build yourself another Thaumcraft Table and set it down close to your Research Table, then Right Click your Wand onto it. This will turn it into an Arcane Workbench!                                    You can now craft magical items, using the stored Vis in the Wand. Make yourself some Copper Wand Caps please!

Now that you have an Arcane Worktable, you can make another fairly nifty item that should help in early research. In the Basic Information tab, you should see a new research brancing from Research Expertise called Deconstruction Table. Go ahead and complete the research and make it.     This special Table will break down objects to their base Aspects, converting them into Research Points for your Research Table. It's only a small chance to get Research Points, but the more Aspects an item contains, the bigger the chance.

See, just holding a Thaumometer all the time when searching for Aura Nodes isn't very fun. It's also dangerous!  You could run into something like a wall or a bear!           One of the new researches for you is in the Artificing tab, which will show you how to make the Goggles of Revealing. When worn, these will make Aura Nodes glow as if you were looking through a Thaumometer.                                On top of that, every Node you scan with a Thaumometer will be 'remembered' by your Thauminomicon, and you can press i on your keyboard (by default) to show a list, and have an arrow show up when you are wearing your Goggles of Revealing! Quite handy!

To finish off your lesson of basic Wand Crafting, you'll need to use something a little nicer for your Wand core. Normal wooden sticks are all well and good at the beginning, but not very Thaumic, no?                                             Exploring around, you may have seen some great big trees made of dark wood, usually with cobwebs among the branches. These are Greatwood Trees, and their wood great Wand material! Locate one and cut it down, and try to get a few Saplings from the leaves as well!                                              Afterward, research the Greatwood Wand Core in the Artifice tab and make one. When you make a Wand out of Greatwood, it can hold twice as much Vis as your starter Wand!

Now that we have improved the core of the Wand, we can improve the Caps as well. Gold is a fantastic conductor, not only of electricity, but also magic! Unlike Iron, it has no Vis penalty when used in a Wand.

quests.name: Intermediate Wandcraft
quests.description: Now that you've got a solid basis in making and using Wands, I think it's time to expand on what you can do with them!                        Wand Cores and Wand Caps are not the only way to improve your Wand. Another way is to use Foci, special additions to your Wand you can swap around easily without having to make a new Wand. Each one does something different, and all are quite useful.                         Oh, a note on using and changing Wand Focus. You might need to rebind your Wand Focus key in the options under Miscellanious. Might I suggest Semicolon ( ; )?

tasks.longDescription: In your Thaumaturgy tab, the first Foci you can make is called Fire, under the Research : Wand Focus.                                          After making it you can attatch it to your Wand using the Wand Focus key (be sure to rebind it!) and selecting it from the radial menu that pops up. Now when you hold the Wand and Right Click, a stream of fire will jet out!                 If you want to remove a Focus, Sneak when you hit the Wand Focus key.
Researching the Excavation Wand Focus gives you quite a handy tool, letting you dig through many materials

Researching the Equal Trade focus will give you quite a useful tool for decorating and designing constructions. It allows you to exchange one type of material in the world for another in your Inventory!                                     To choose the material you want to change something TO, place it in the world, and Sneak + Right Click your Wand on it with the Focus equipped. You can then Left Click on a block to exchange it with your chosen block, as long as you have it in your Inventory.                        Right Clicking will exchange a whole group of blocks, if you have enough materials! It will only exchange blocks that have one face touching the open Air though!

Wiggle gets annoyed when I just leave my Wand Foci around, so now that you've got a couple we should probably make some sort of Storage for it.                                Researching the Focus Pouch will enable you to safely store all your Wand Foci, as well as easily exchange which one your Wand is using, which most other bags do not let you.

These two Foci are quite useful for attacking and defending yourself.                                      The Frost focus will fire a solid, icy projectile that will bounce off things. Careful, cause it can hurt you, but it can also be angled right to hit something around a corner.         The Shock focus simply hurls bolts of lightning at your target!

quests.name: The Basics of Alchemy
quests.description: I think its time to teach you about another Thaumatic principle : Alchemy. Throwing a bunch of ingredients in a pot, add a final touch, and wizard you got a spell going on. Or a complete mess, one of the two!                                     Yes, Alchemy is pretty much tossing a bunch of ingredients into what we call a Cauldron, and then poof you got something new! But what items? What ingredients? What order? Does it matter if its the heart of a swamp-born Creeper or a desert-born? Just what species of bird is required for the right Feather?                                       As a Thaumaturge, you'll learn the answer to these questions are : Sometimes! Usually it doesn't matter, except when it does! Isn't Magic fun?

tasks.longDescription: Okay, to start with we'll need a simple Cauldron. Place it over some sort of flame or heat source. I prefer making a nice looking area out of stone, with a bit of Lava right under the Cauldron.                  When you have that, go ahead and Right Click one of your Wands onto it to turn it into a Crucible.

Now, got some water in your Crucible? If not, go add some. Go on!                                              So the first thing we'll learn how to make is Nitor, which is a magical flame. The research is in your Alchemy tab. To make them, we'll need certain aspects. If you hold Shift and highlight items in your inventory, if you've scanned them with your Thaumometer you'll see what Aspects make it. For Nitor, we'll need 3 Lux, 3 Ignis, and 3 Potentia, as well as a Glowstone Dust to bind it all together.                The Lux is simple, just grab 3 normal Torches! The Potentia and Ignis is a bit more difficult...until you look at Charcoal, and a single piece has two of each! Grab two Charcoal as well!                              Now go over to your Crucible, and throw in the three Torches, the two Charcoal, and LAST throw in the Glowstone. You'll want to do this fast, as Aspects in the Crucible will break down if you aren't fast enough.

Good, you got the Nitor! And, well, something else perhaps?             Sometimes when you have a lot more Aspects in your Crucible than you need for an Alchemisation, it will break down and come out of the Crucible as a Purple liquid or gas. Well, this is what we call Taint. And it isn't good, but its part of the balance of the World.                        I suggest carrying some Dirt or Wood, and Sneak + Right Clicking the top of the cauldron to place it when you see the Purple gunk to break it up.                                    Now then, go ahead and research Alumentum on your Alchemy tab and make it. You'll use Charcoal like in the Nitor recipe, but it wants Perdito instead of Lux, and the Catalyst (the last object you throw in) is another piece of Charcoal.                                       I'll give you a hint on finding Perdito if you are having trouble : It's everywhere just a bit under your feet.                                     Now be careful with it, it's a bit more...volatile...than Nitor.

Magic Tallow is a useful in many Thaumaturgic applications. The research can be found in the Alchemy tab, and it is fairly simple to make.                                        You will need some Rotten Flesh from a Zombie for the Catalyst, as well as a few Praecantio Aspect. This aspect is a little harder to find, but the easiest to me is using Moss Cobblestone, which you can make with some Cobblestone, a Bucket of Water, and a single Wheat.    You can take the resulting Magic Tallow and turn into a Tallow Candle, which has some slight magical properties I'll cover later.

Sorry about naming all these tasks after that very old Witch poem. It's a little joke and rivalry we have between the Thaumaturge and Witchcraft branches in the Ferret Business. We have the utmost respect with each other, though, as we both strive to protect this world from Darkness.        What? No, I'll cover that later, don't worry! For now, we're breaking apart from the Natural traditions of Witchcraft and I will teach you how to transmute Metal!       Yes yes, Lead into Gold is possible, but very inefficient. You can make more by selling Lead as a commodity to the right Market! No, instead, research the Magical Metallurgy in the Alchemy tab.              This will teach you how to make Thaumium, which is a magical metal, quite useful in many things, not in the least in armor and tools!

The last basic thing you can make you don't even need to research. It's just an item you'll need for many other Thaumaturgic excursions.                                   By taking one of the Crystal Shards, and throwing it into a Crucible that contains TWO of each other missing basic element, you will create a Balance Shard.                  For example, if you have an Order Shard, you need to add Perdito, Aqua, Ignis, Aer, and Terra to the Crucible.

quests.name: The Basics of Research
quests.description: Hmm hmmm, okay, you have some materials, enough to get you started at least. To properly understand Magic, you'll need to do what every grand wizard has done since the dawn of time : research!        Now don't give me that look. To properly control the power  you can wield, you'll need to research how it works and how to harness it. Given your world is under strange...rules...this is also a matter of safety for both of us! I mean, if you summoned some tentacled beast from the dungeon dimension, boy would both our faces be red!              From all the blood, that is. Ours. I'm not sure their blood is red...or if they even bleed....

tasks.longDescription: A good Thaumaturge needs a sturdy desk, a quill and ink, and some nice writing paper.                    For the desk, you'll want to make two Tables (make sure they are Thaumcraft style ones!). This will give you plenty of tabletop space, cause invariably you'll cover half of it with piles of random junk.           Or is that just me? I'm pretty sure it's a wizardly thing...

Now, place the two Tables side by side, then Right Click the Scribing Tools on top. This will arrange them into a Research Table. Now Right Click the Table to start researching!                          In the Table, you can see the Scribing Tools in the upper left. To the right of that, a place for Paper.  Below these you should see a handfull of colored symbols : these are called Aspects. Almost everything in the universe is made of these, from Stones to Tools to Monsters, and there are lots of them.                                             Right now, you only know the basic ones. To learn more, you can combined two aspects by clicking them, then clicking the button with two arrows pointing at each other. Many combinations will not work, though, and each combination will consume a research point from that Aspect.                                       To get more research points, make the Thaumometer and just explore a bit. Hold it and aim at something, then hold Right Click to scan it. At the start, you can't scan many things, but as your Thaumatic Knowledge increases, more things will be scannable! You can also scan items in chests and your own inventory : Pick up the Thaumometer and just hold it over the item to scan it.                                        Again, Wiggles and I want to emphasize that you should scan EVERYTHING you can. Items, creatures, whatever! You won't be able to scan much to start, but each new Aspect you unlock will allow you to scan even more!

On the Basic Information tab of your Thauminomicon, click and drag to go to the right side of the researches you can do. You'll see one marked Research Expertise with an eye for a symbol. It should be flashing. Any knowledge flashing like this means you can begin research on it, if you click it when you have Scribing Tools and Paper in your inventory.                           Click it so you get a set of Research Notes. You can then place it into the research table, in the Paper slot, and the right side will unveil the research grid for you. It's a bit complicated, so please refer to the Thauminomicon for better instructions!

In Thaumcraft there are two ways things are researched. I've explained the more complicated one to you already.                               The other is a bit simpler : some researches the Thauminomicon only requires a payment of certain Aspects to divulge its secrets to you.

Now, originally Wiggles and I came up with these Crystal Clusters as a way to make this place look even more wizard. But we found out that the ones near our Research Table appeared to do something else : The Aspects of the Crystal Clusters nearby very slowly regenerated in the table!           The recharge rate is super slow, but it's really better than nothing! You can make a Mixed Crystal Cluster with one of each type of basic Shard, but if you use six of a single type, you make a Crystal Cluster of that one.

quests.name: A Bit of Basics
quests.description: As I may have mentioned, I...well, I'm not from this dimension. I was summoned here by Master Watson and we formed a magical contract. I work for him for thirty years, and we share the power in the end and I return home.                                Er...yeah...um...where were we? Oh yes, Aura! Aura comes in many colors, but the most common is White. Each color behaves in a certain way when moving between Nodes and being Pumped higher.          Why don't we create something similar to the design in the Primer I gave you?

tasks.longDescription: White Aura Crystals are the standard. Right Clicking one onto an Aura Node will add a thousand White Aura to the Node.                             Nodes are where Aura is stored. They connect on the same horizontal level if they are directly North, South, East, or West of each other, and within 16 blocks. Connected Nodes will share Aura until they reach equilibrium.                Nodes will also connect vertically, but Aura will not flow upwards on its own, only downward.

So, I mentioned Aura can't move upwards on its own (usually..) right? Well...to make Power, we kind of need to, unless we want to waste a lot of materials making thousands of Crystals...                                  This is where Pumps come in. They connect to an Aura network just like a regular node, but feed a pump the proper material and it will send Aura upward to another connected node.                             For example : The Burning Aura Pump will consume Coal or other burnable material to move Aura upwards. Just drop the material next to the pump and it will consume it.

So, when Aura flows downward in a network, it generates Power. Kind of like a watermill. This Power can be used for a variety of things, usually in something we call a Consumer.                                     Consumers...well uh...consume Power. The name is pretty spot on....they consume Power to do a task. What they do and how much Power varies on the Consumer.            For example, the Cascading Processor is a Consumer, and one of the main ones you'll need.

This might be useful for you to make as well. The Monitor can be placed next to any Pump or Consumer.                                     If next to a Pump, when it is no longer Pumping, the Monitor will emit a Redstone Signal.                           If next to a Consumer, when it no longer has any work, the Monitor will emit a Redstone Signal as well.

quests.name: Auramatic Metal
quests.description: Could you set up an Aura Network for that Cascading Processor I had you build? I can...I mean...just take your time. no rush, right?                                          Got it? Okay...well, the Cascading Processor is used to fuse some basic materials into Arcane materials. They'll be infused with some Aura, and we'll need them to make better Cascading Consumers, Pumps, and other things!                   What will you need? Well, uh...a bunch of Iron will be good. And Diamonds! No wait, thats later...Oh oh, and some Wool. In lots of colors!

tasks.longDescription: With Arcane materials, there are 8 basic colors : Black, White, Blue, Red, Orange, Green, Yellow, and Purple.                                         The first tier of material is Metal. You get it by dropping an Iron Ingot and a Wool of the color you want next to a Cascading Processor. Supply enough Power and it'll fuse them into an Arcane Ingot!                                          Could you make 3 of each color, please? I know it seems like a lot, but you'll need all of them!

quests.name: Colorful Auras
quests.description: I mentioned that Aura comes in lots of colors, right? I'm pretty sure I did...                                    Well, yes, there are a few colors of Aura other than White! Each one has special properties to it. Some of these are easier to Pump upwards, others produce more Power when its raining.               Mastering the various colors of Aura can enable you to create a lot of Power for much less than just using White Aura.

tasks.longDescription: Blue Aura is really easy to Pump upwards. It takes a fourth of the energy to Pump upward, but only while its raining. Otherwise, it will take twice as much power to Pump!       Either way, it produces the same amount of Power when falling.

Green Aura changes weight depending on if its day or night.           During the day, it weighs twice as much as White Aura, so it takes 2x more to Pump upward, but produces 2x more Power.                   At night, it weights 50% of White Aura, so its easier to Pump, but produces half the Power as well.

Yellow Aura is easier to Pump, taking only half the energy of White Aura, while still producing the same amount of Power.                              The downside is that Yellow Aura will slowly break down while in Aura Nodes, meaning you'll have to supply more at some point.

Violet Aura will multiply itself in an Aura Node until it reaches 2.5k Violet Aura. You can spread it among multiple Nodes and it will keep multiplying, but if it ever drops below 25 Aura in a Node, it will dissipate, going away.

These two colors of Aura are special, as they can be considered alternates to each other.                   Black Aura will not flow downhill, nor Pump uphill. It will only travel horizontally.                                   Orange Aura, though, will only flow vertically.                                There is a special device you can use to convert between the two I will talk about later.
Red Aura has a unique property in that when TNT is detonated next to a node with Red Aura, it will instead absorb the explosion and move the Red Aura vertically, much like a Pump.

quests.name: The Powerful Vortex
quests.description: The Cascading Processor is a good device, but its pretty uh...weak? No not weak...low tech! Let's go with that! It's still useful, just not very powerful!                    Many things we'll create will need a whole lot more Power infused into them. To accomplish this, we'll need to use Vortex Infusion!                                        Vortex Infusion allows us to combine and infuse up to four items into one powerful item! These items will take longer to create, so you'll need to either automate your Aura Network, or tend to it yourself!            Many recipes will also require you to generate Power with a specific color of Aura. So having a really good setup is important!

tasks.longDescription: The primary thing we'll need is the Vortex Controller. This is another Power Consumer device, and it will require a lot of Power for each item.

As I said, the Controller will need a lot of Power, but you can't supply it with just basic Aura Nodes.                                          Instead, you'll need to make four Vortex Pedastals, and place them directly North, South, East, and West of the Controller.                These will act just like a normal Aura Node, collecting Power and sharing Aura through the network, but they will also hold the items you need for each Vortex Infusion.

There are a lot of things you can make with Vortex Infusion. You can combine 4 Rotten Flesh into 1 Leather, for example. Just Right Click the item onto each Vortex Pedastal to place it.                         You can also infuse higher tier materials for crafting. If you take 3 of any Arcane Metal (see why I had you make that many?), and a Diamond, and put them into the Vortex Infuser, you can make an Arcane Gem of that color!                 I won't ask you to make all 8 colors, just one: Violet!

quests.name: Quite Prismatic
quests.description: Didn't I say the Cascading Processor was kinda...low end? Well, I have good news!                           With the addition of Arcane Gems to our material list, we can now combine them into a third level of material!                                        Grab one of each color  Arcane Gem (thats 8, remember!), and toss them down near a Cascading Processor! Feed it some Power, and out will pop an Arcane Prism!              I'll note though...while it takes the same amount of Power to do a task...it requires a lot more Power at one time, so it will work faster as long as it is properly Powered!

tasks.longDescription: While it doesn't look like much, the Arcane Prism has lots of infused Aura power within it!

The Prismatic Processor does everything the Cascading Processor does.                             Though, instead of turning Ore into 2 Dust, it turns it into 3!              It can also break down colored Wool into its respective Dye!

quests.name: Angels of Metal
quests.description: So, we've been making a lot of just...materials right? Materials and devices. Well, I have some more materials for us to make, but this material is very special!                    Angel's Steel is a very powerful metal. You've heard of folding metal a thousand times, correct? That is sort of what Angel's Steel is, except we're folding in thousands of Power into each ingot!                   You will first need a Cascading Synthesizer. More importantly, though, you'll need a really good Aura  Power setup! Angel's Steel requires 10,000 Power per step...thats 10,000 Power each 'cycle'!                                        Needless to say, I don't think just a few Burning Aura Pumps will suffice for this...

tasks.longDescription: Some Iron Ingots and an Arcane Prism, and a whooole lot of Power, will create the Synthesizer. It's only task is to create Angel's Steel by folding and condensing Power into an Ingot.
Angel's Steel is classified in Degrees. A freshly synthesized Ingot will be of the First Degree.

You can use Angel Steel Ingots much like Iron to make tools.  You can make a Pickaxe, an Axe, or a Shovel.                                          Angel's Steel Tools have four properties, and a First Degree tool will have only the lowest levels in them.                                             Efficiency : Dig Speed.                  Fortune : Bonus Drops.                 Shatter : Increases speed on harder materials.                             Disintegration : Increases speed on very soft materials.

By shaping Angel's Steel into a blade and using an Aura Crystal as a handle, you get a powerful Sword, which causes special things to happen when you hit an enemy with the sword:                                      Red : Causes fires to randomly start.                                            Orange : Causes enemies to randomly fly into the air.                    Yellow : Causes lightning to strike.                                           Green : Causes a sickness that spreads.                                        Blue : Will start rapidly damaging the enemy when they are below half health.                             Violet : Causes instability, the enemy will occasionally switch places with other entities nearby.

Angel's Steel of the first degree is fairly powerful, but that is only the beginning. Like folding steel, the more you fold it, the more powerful it becomes!                        By dropping 3 of the same degree of Angel's Steel next to a Synthesizer, it will automatically fold them into a single Ingot of the next degree.                                 There are 11 degrees of Angel's Steel. Each degree beyond the first will grant tools bonus Dig Speed. Each degree will also add 2 points to a tool's special stats, randomly distributed between them.

quests.name: Speciality Nodes
quests.description: The basic Aura Node is good for most things, yeah? Well, to make the most of Aura, you'll want to use some of these special nodes in your designs!

tasks.longDescription: The Conserving Aura Node will not send  Aura downhill. It's helpful when making more compact designs, or when using something like Red Aura.

Red and Orange Aura both work differently, which I explain in another place. These two Manipulators are special, though.        When they have no Redstone Signal, they will only accept their chosen color and destroy it.              With a Redstone Signal, the Manipulator Node will generate more of its chosen color.

The Aura Capacitor will collect Aura without sending it back out until it reaches its capacity, which can be configured by Shift + Right Clicking it.                                      When it goes over this threshhold, it will release its Aura all at once, and then go into a cooldown mode for a few seconds where it will not collect any more Aura.

I've studied some of your world and notice you use a lot of this energy you call Redstone Flux, or RF. Well, the Master helped me design this special Node to convert Power into RF Energy.                      It creates an Aura Bubble around it and adjacent RF Energy machines, powering up to 4 of them.      Note though, that the Aura Bubble looks out for Pipes in the bubble or connected to the bubble. If more than 4 Machines/Pipes are connected, it will not power them, so you cannot power an entire construction with a Fluxing Node.

quests.name: Pumped Up
quests.description: Those Burning Aura Pumps aren't the greatest, huh? They're pretty simple to make, though, and a good introduction to them. I got a lot more I can show you!                   Each of these pumps requires a different kind of "fuel" to power. Sometimes its a material it consumes, like the Burning Pump consumes burnable things like Coal. Others require some sort of interaction, like being shot with an arrow.              Pumps have two parts to them : Speed, which is how much Aura they pump at once, and Duration, which is how long they pump for.

tasks.longDescription: The Illumination Pump will consume Torches placed near it to Pump Aura.                                     It will also consume Glowstone in the same way, and provide more Duration than a torch, but the same Speed.                                          It's important to note that only 'normal' Torches and Glowstone will usually work. The Pump is kind of picky.
The Projectile Pump feeds off things being thrown or shot at it. Specifically, Snowballs, Arrows, and Eggs. Each one of these gives a different amount of Speed and Duration.

The Redstone Aura Pump will consume a line of up to 15 Redstone Dust, but only when its powered (Which will let you place the Redstone down first, without it suddenly vanishing on you!).              Place down the Redstone Dust in a line leading from the Pump. Each dust adds more Duration. Use a Redstone Torch to power the end of the Redstone Dust line, and the Pump will consume the line.
The Momentum Aura Pump is fueled by creatures falling near it.     Each blocks worth of height the creature has fallen from adds to the Pump's Duration.

One of the improvements the Master has helped me with on these Pumps is to create what we call Alternating Pumps.                           These pumps are more efficient, but at a cost. Their output amount varies wildly over about an eight minute period. The Master calls it 'sinusoidally' I believe, which I've come to understand is kind of like a rollercoaster.                                 If you can time things fairly well, I feel you can take really good advantage of these. Since you'll have spare Burning Pumps, I'll only ask you to make an Alternating one of them, though each Pump has an alternating version.

quests.name: Bombastic Rituals
quests.description: So, I've come to understand you have two special worlds right next to yours on the dimensional planes. The Master says that you've started calling them The Nether and The End. Both are also quite dangerous by the sounds of it!           So what if you could convert a small area of your world into a slice of one of those? Safer, more controllable, and less dangerous.       Well, I know of a special Ritual that should allow you to do just that! The Rituals are contained within a device you use much like any other Consumer : feed it enough Power over time to activate it.

tasks.longDescription: The Ritual of the Nether will steadily convert the Biome you place this device into a Nether biome while it is being Powered. It will transmute the appropriate blocks into their Nether equivilants as well.
Works just like the Ritual of Nether, except it brings a nice slice of the End home to you.

quests.name: Knowledge is Storage
quests.description: Ever heard the term Knowledge is Power? Most likely, its pretty commonly said around here. Well, books contain knowledge. and possessions denote power (the more you have, the more 'powerful' you are), and with Aura, you can now store items in books!                   Sounds crazy, right? Well, I'll try to explain it as best I can. You can also look at the Encyclopedia Aura for a more in depth explanation.

tasks.longDescription: To start, you'll need to make a Storage Book. You'll also need some 'regular' bookshelves. Master calls them "Vanilla" bookshelves, as they aren't fancy or anything.                  When you Right Click a Storage Book onto a Bookshelf, it will turn Purple and convert it into a Book Storage Shelf.

To interact with this Book storage system, you'll need a Bookshelf Coordinator.  You'll need to constantly Power the Bookshelf Coordinator as well, as the more items you store, the more Bookshelves you have, the more Power it requires.                           All Storage Bookshelves you want to connect to the Coordinator have to:                                        1) Be connected together with other Storage or normal Bookshelves, and                            2) Have Line of Sight to the Coordinator.                                  You can then access the Storage system by Right Clicking the Coordinator.
There are a wide variety of Storage Books you can make. Each one stores items differently. These are two common ones to use, but you can reference the Encyclopedia Aura for all the rest.

quests.name: Arcane Tools
quests.description: I know a lot of what we've done is just make and condense Power into better and better materials, so how about we utilize them in more interesting ways?                           These items and tools should be quite helpful in various ways, and I dare say some of them are especially useful to you in your current...well, predicament.

tasks.longDescription: The Mirror of the Angel should help you when fighting those strange, haunting creatures called Ghasts.                                         You can Left Click on a Ghast Fireball, or Right Click close to it to reflect the Fireball back towards the closest Ghast. It will also speed up the Fireball!

We can harness the Power in these materials in various interesting ways. Some of the most interesting are the Portable Holes.      The Portable Black Hole will consume all the Cobblestone in your inventory. Great for long mining trips!                                   The Portable Red Hole is arguably more useful. Its also, not arguably, much much much more dangerous. When dropped on the ground, it will literally explode every 5 seconds. And when I say explode, I mean a pretty big explosion. You'll need some kind of heavy duty armor or protection versus explosions to use this properly...

The Sword of the Barbarian is an excellent weapon for fighting very strong monsters or large groups of them.                               Every time you hit an enemy within 5 seconds of the last hit increases the damage of the weapon.                                         Can you get to a 100 hit combo?
The Sword of the Thief is a uh...bit more of a bad person's tool.      Every Villager you kill with the sword will have a 25% chance of dropping the item they were offering for trade.

The Transmuting Sword will, well... transform... common creatures between two states. Here's the list for you :                                       Cow - Mooshroom                        Sheep - Pig                               Ghast - Blaze                             Slime - Magma Cube                      Ocelot - Wolf

The Prismatic Wand can definitely help you copy your constructions. It has three modes: Select, Copy, and Paste; you can switch between them by Shift + Right Clicking the Wand.                            In Select Mode, Right Click two corners of a cube shape that contains the structure you want.        Switch to Copy mode and Right Click it to copy it.                            Lastly, in Paste mode, Right Click where you want to copy the structure to. It will consume all the blocks from your inventory, so make sure you have everything you need!

quests.name: General Consumption
quests.description: Now, we've made a bunch of materials, right? A few other things but...mostly materials. How about we put them to use, yes?                       These are some pretty simple things you can make. Three of them are Consumers, which will require Power to do tasks. The other two are some basic construction materials you can make.

tasks.longDescription: You'll need a lot of colored Wool for making Arcane materials, and the Cascading Colorer will help you!     For a little bit of Power, it will constantly cause Sheep near it to regrow their Wool, and it will also dye it a random color.
The Cascading Smelter, as long as it is given Power, will Smelt items dropped near it, like turning Ore into Ingots. It will also prevent any items dropped near it from despawning.

Master says you don't really have much transportation over there, other than Minecarts and some teleportation. Sometimes I like to just walk around though, but you don't get very far...                   Traveler's Bricks will help here! Make a roadway with them, and when you start running on them, they'll speed you up really fast in the direction you are going!

The Rebounding Enigma is a dangerous block, just to warn you! If you or any other creature steps on it, it will catapult you hundreds of blocks into the air!         I suggest carrying a parachute or something...

Oh oh, my Master has just helped me finish a new thing you might be interested in! See, I like fish...a lot...and well I wanted so...huh? Oh sorry!                         The Cascading Fisher, when placed over a 3x3 area of Water, will automatically fish for you when Powered!

quests.name: Bits and Baubles
quests.description: So we've made a lot of interesting this so far! Materials, some devices, maybe a weapon or two perhaps...but not too much on the more defensive side, right?           Well, time to change that. I know of a bunch of different amulets and rings and stuff that should really help you out!                        (You can equip Baubles by opening your Inventory, and hitting the small ring button in the upper right of your portrait.)

tasks.longDescription: With enough String, you can turn some of the Arcane Gems into protective amulets! You can only wear one at a time, but each one protects you from something different :                                     Red protects you from Fire and Lava.                                           Orange protects you from Explosions.                                    Yellow protects you from Projectiles.                                   Green protects you from Fall Damage.                                        Blue protects you from Drowning.                                      Purple protects you from the effects of the Wither, but you won't regenerate health.

Faries are constructs made of Aura that can help you in a wide variety of ways.                             To harness their power, you'll first need to make a Ring of Binding and equip it.                                  Then you need to make a basic Fairy Charm. On its own, it won't do anything, but you can further augment it in a wide variety of ways, which are detailed in the Encyclopedia Aura.                         You can then hold and Right Click a Fairy Charm to put into the Ring of Binding if you have it equipped. It can hold up to 15 Fairies. To remove them, hold the Ring of Binding and Shift + Right Click.

The Ring of the Shattered Stone will absorb most of energy from an explosion within 4 blocks. The blast will then only affect things like Stone, Dirt, and Gravel, and leave more precious resources intact.

The Amulet of the Forbidden Fruit will apply a random potion effect to you each time you eat any food.                                      The same food item will always grant the same potion effect.

Amulet of the Angel's Wing will allow you to travel vertically fairly quickly.                                         By pressing Up on your keyboard, you will teleport up through terrain to the next safe standing spot, if there is one.            Pressing Down will do the same, except you'll descend through terrain.

Sash of the Angel's Heels will allow you to travel up hills with ease.                                           Just by moving toward a hill, you will instantly walk up to three block high hills. If you encounter a vertical wall thats higher, walking against it will charge the Sash and eventually allow you to step on top of the obstical.

quests.name: Advanced Consumption
quests.description: I've shown you how to make some pretty simple Consumers right? Now with some Arcane Gems, we can make some even more powerful ones!                                These Consumers will take a bit more Power than the basic ones, keep in mind. But with great Power comes...well, better results!

tasks.longDescription: The Cascading Grower will speed up the growth of most plants above it.                                                Place a Dirt block on top of the Grower, then till it and plant a crop. When Powered, the plant will grow much faster!

Gathering all the materials for the various Potions becoming troublesome? Well, the Cascading Brewer can help.                             By dropping Water Bottles near the Brewer and supplying enough Power, it will randomly add brewing ingredients to it. The potion you'll end up with will be random, but you won't have to supply anything but Water Bottles.
The Cascading Looter requires a lot of Power, but in return it will randomly create items you can find in any Dungeon chest!
While being Powered, the Cascading Spawner will spawn creatures and monsters above it.      The creatures it can spawn represent any you'd usually find in that area.

The Kaleidoscope Enchanter is a very interesting Consumer. It will imbue Swords or Tools with one or more Color based Enchantments.          The difference with these enchantments is colors will interact and combine with each other in different ways, vastly increasing the number of possibilities.                 You should consult the Encyclopedia Aura to see all the combinations and how to use the Enchanter properly.

quests.name: Singularity Mining
quests.description: We have sooo much Power condensed into all these materials, don't we? So much Power that if we aren't careful, it could collapse on itself...                                          Nah not really! But that thought does segway nicely into this little device. See, if you condense enough Power in a certain way, you can make it collapse on itself into a Singularity. While very dangerous, this Singularity can be harnessed by us to draw resources from other dimensions.                            So, to create and harness this Singularity, we'll need a Cascading Miner and some Fortified Blocks.           I highly suggest building this away from your base or anything you hold dear...a Singularity that prematurely collapses causes quite the explosion...

tasks.longDescription: The first thing you'll need to do is create a chamber with Fortified Blocks. You can make these with a Cascading Processor by mixing End Stone with one of six blocks : Dirt, Cobblestone, Stone, Glass, Wood Planks, or Obsidian.                           Each material takes a different amount of damage to break, and repairs at a different speed. If a Fortified Block takes too much damage, it will be destroyed.

The Cascading Miner, when Powered, will generate a Singularity 1.5 blocks below it. When a Redstone Signal is applied to it, it will collapse the Singularity and create Ores from the energy.                             While the Singularity exists, it will move around. If it hits a Fortified Block, it will damage the area and bounce. Every bounce will increase the speed of the Singularity.              To generate any Ores at all, the Singularity must exist for at least 20 seconds. The longer it exists, the more Ore it will generate.             If the Singularity hits a non-Fortified Block? Well...don't. Simple as that. The block won't exist anymore, probably

quests.name: Node Manipulation
quests.description: As you progress as a Thaumaturge, you've probably noticed you've needed to visit old Aura Nodes and find many new ones, whether its to recharge a Wand, charge a new one, or obtain Essences from one.                         Well, this can definitely become a bit of a hassle, especially as bigger spells mean bigger costs. Thankfully, we have plenty of ways to deal with this, the least of which is just moving the Nodes to a much handier location!                             From there, you can manipulate nodes in various ways, build devices to utilize them better, etc.

tasks.longDescription: In your Basic Information tab, you should make sure you have Node Preserver and Master Node Tapping researched. This will open up the Research for Node in a Jar.     This unlocks the ability for you to create a Warded Jar...for an Aura Node, that is. By surrounding an Aura Node in Glass, and topping it with Wooden Slabs, you create a large jar. Right Clicking the Glass with a Wand that has 70 of each Vis in it and voila!                                 You have magically shrunk down this construct, freezing the Aura Node inside. You can now break the Jar to pick it up, and move the Aura Node to a new home! Just place it back down and Right Click your Wand on it to release it!

Nodes can be fickle creatures. If you place a few near each other, they can 'draw' vis from other ones to boost themselves. Some nodes are "Fading" and slowly losing Vis capacity. These make collecting Nodes a bit of a hassle.                                         In the Thaumaturgy tab, you'll find a bunch of useful devices. The first of which is the Node Stabilizer. When placed under a Node, it will stop it from drawing Vis from nearby Nodes. It also stops Fading Nodes from losing Vis, and has a small chance of repairing them into Pale Nodes.                                    The downside is the power to do this will come from the Node itself. The recharge rate of the Node will be halved to power the Stabilizer.

We've solved the 'running around' problem of recharging your Wand. Now we can solve the 'wave Wand at for power' part of it too!                                             The Wand Recharge Pedestal can hold any of your Wands, and will draw Vis from nearby Aura Nodes to recharge it.                       As long as you aren't using cheap Iron and Stick Wands, you won't run the risk of depleting and damaging the Nodes.

Invariably, you've probably come across a Node or two with Compound Aspects, the aspects you combine the 6 basic Aspects to create.
